citation.article-title: Desulfobacca acetoxidans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel acetate-degrading sulfate reducer isolated from sulfidogenic granular sludge.

p.s: Desulfobacca (de.sul.fo.bac'ca. L. pref. de from; L. n. sulfur sulfur ; M.L. pref. Desulfo- desulfuricating, used to characterize a dissimilatory sulfate-reducing prokaryote; L. fem. n. baca or bacca berry, especially olive ; M.L. fem. n. Desulfobacca a sulfate-reducing, olive-shaped bacterium)
Sulfate or other inorganic sulfur compounds, but not elemental sulfur, serve as terminal electron acceptor and are reduced to H2S.

Acetate is the common electron donor and carbon source, and is completely oxidized to CO2 via the CO-dehydrogenase pathway. Desulfobacca belongs to the delta subclass of the Proteobacteria; the closest relatives are Desulfosarcina variabilis, Desulfacinum infernum and Syntrophus buswellii.
